intro: Chaenorhinum pluttulum, commonly known as the common yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
